I'd rather have Riven get a PROJECT or Blood Moon skin rather than a star guardian skin, her personality doesn't really fit.
How does Syndra, Jinx, or Ahri fit then?

Syndra and Jinx are actually fitting in because they are the spice of their teams.

Jinx is the type of girl that doesn't follow the rules, doesn't really want to work with a group of people and, eventually, abandons the team for a period of time until she gets convinced or grows attached to the others. 

She is also a very crazy and destructive person, something pretty difficult to have in an organised group, and it makes the combination of personalities more interesting.

Syndra comes from nowhere. Nobody knows why she is alone, what happened to her team, and how she survived. Because of her immensely amount of power, and hunger for it, her team may question her intentions. "Did she make a pact with the devil for power? Did she kill her team because of the pact, or just for fun? She may have not betrayed her team, but maybe she abandoned them? Will she do the same with us?"

From the way Riot phrased her SG lore, it is clear that she is a really big question mark and in any kind of genre this makes the plot far more interesting.

About Ahri... I think that she is that popular cheerleader that considers herself above everyone, including her team. She may have the skills to be a leader. However, from her interactions, we can understand that she is not always the "good" girl. It seems like she is switching sides depending on which Star Guardian she fights.

This leads to the idea that Ahri is an unstable part of the team. Combined with the fact that she is the leader, she may actually tear apart the team after betraying them (but I think Miss Fortune would take up her role, and that they will eventually fight each other). I believe she is the classical I switch sides, and, unlike Jinx, she actually allies with the evil.
I don't think Ahri would ever betray her team. She loves her team. She would probably betray the First Star if anything, that I fully believe. But not her team
